title: Mike Tomlin Steps Down as Steelers Coach After 19 Seasons
snippets: Tomlin stepped down as Steelers coach Tuesday

Mike Tomlin likely would be one of the hottest names on the market if he wanted to coach next season. It doesn’t look like that will be the case, though. NFL teams have contacted Tomlin to express interest, but he doesn’t plan to coach in the 2026 season, NFL Network’s Ian Rapoport reported Wednesday. Tomlin stepped down as head coach of the Pittsburgh Steelers one day after the team lost 30-6 to the visiting Houston Texans in a wild-card game earlier this week. Tomlin, 53, did not have a losing season in 19 years as coach of the Steelers, but also lost his last seven playoff games. The...

The 53-year-old Tomlin stepped away from his head coaching job with the Steelers on Tuesday after 19 seasons.

Tomlin's largely successful run in Pittsburgh has come to an end
From a Super Bowl win to his unprecedented run without a losing record to his late career struggles in the postseason, Mike Tomlin's legacy with the Steelers and the NFL is vast.
Andrew Siciliano, Charles Robinson, and Frank Schwab break down the fallout in Pittsburgh as Mike Tomlin steps down after 19 seasons.
Who could replace the head coach, how does this impact Aaron Rodgers and the QB position, and more questions.
A look at what the former Steelers' coach might do next
The Steelers owner said he was 'willing to take another run at it next year' with Tomlin
Art Rooney II said he didn't try to talk Mike Tomlin out of stepping down.
"We were always in contention with Mike, and that's what counts," Rooney said. "He represented the Steelers with class and dignity every single day."

title: CFL Proposes Rule to Eliminate Tie Games in Regular Season
snippets: It's been proposed if the score remains even after overtime, it would be decided by alternating plays from the opposition's three-yard line until one scores and the other doesn't.

The CFL rules committee is proposing the elimination of tie games during the regular season. If a CFL regular-season game is tied after regulation time, a maximum of two overtime rounds are held with teams gaining possession at the opponent’s 35-yard line. Should the score remain even after two possessions, the game goes down as a tie in the standings. Under the rules committee proposal, if the score remains even following overtime, it would be decided by alternating plays from the opposition’s three-yard line until one team scores and the other does not. CFL playoff games, if tied after...
titles: CFL committee proposes change to how regular-season tie games end
CFL rules committee proposes no change to play clock at end of halves
constructiveness_reason: semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.35 (<12 tokens)
summary: The CFL rules committee has proposed eliminating tie games in the regular season. Under the proposal, if a game remains tied after two overtime rounds, teams would alternate plays from the opponent’s three-yard line until one team scores and the other does not, ensuring a winner is decided.
